p: The representative bands of the P. nigrispinus trail in the treated arena part indicated that the geranyl acetate repelled and by citral irritated this predator(Fig. 3). The walking distance with geranyl acetate was shorter (F 2,11 = 8.21, P < 0.002) (Fig. 4a) and the immobile period longer (F 2,11 = 0.41, P = 0.669), (Fig. 4c). The walking distance of P. nigrispinus exposed to citral did not differ from the control (F 2,11 = 0.83, P = 0.449) (Fig. 4b), but the immobile period of this predator (F 2,11 = 4.99, P < 0.016) was longer with this compound (Fig. 4d).
